benchmark_details.name: ManipBench
benchmark_details.overview: ManipBench is a novel open-source benchmark to evaluate the low-level robot manipulation reasoning capabilities of Vision-Language Models (VLMs) through multiple-choice questions covering various dimensions of robotic manipulation. It includes 12,617 questions across different tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate Vision-Language Models for predicting robot actions and identify the best models for robotic manipulation tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to limited resources, not all possible model variants were evaluated. The benchmark does not cover all aspects of manipulation and lacks emphasis on high-level task planning.

data.source: Generated from real-world robotic manipulation data, in-house fabric manipulation datasets, and simulation environments.
data.annotation: Questions are based on pre-processed data from various sources, including annotated images and pre-trained trajectories.

methodology.calculation: Measured the percentage of correct answers from models on multiple-choice questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities of VLMs in robotic manipulation tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation against human performance on a subset of questions.
